00001 /*
00002         -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00003 
00004                        --- CAEN SpA - Computing Systems Division --- 
00005 
00006         -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00007 
00008         Name            :       CONSOLE.c
00009 
00010         Description :   Console library for Linux & Microsoft VISUAL C++  
00011                                         (Win32 implementation).
00012                                         Provide a set of function which permit the console 
00013                                         screen management.
00014 
00015                                         Linux Specifications :
00016 
00017                                         Version:      Linux 1.0
00018                                         Platform:     Linux 2.4.x
00019                                         Language:     GCC 2.95 and 3.0
00020 
00021         Date            :       November 2004
00022         Release         :       1.0
00023         Author          :       C.Landi
00024 
00025 
00026 
00027         -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00028 
00029         This file contains the following procedures and functions:               
00030                                                                           
00031         con_init         initialize the console                                  
00032         con_end          close the console                                       
00033         write_log        write a message into the log file                       
00034         con_getch        get a char from console without echoing                 
00035         con_kbhit        read a char from console without stopping the program   
00036         con_scanf        read formatted data from the console                    
00037         con_printf       print formatted output to the standard output stream    
00038         gotoxy           set the cursor position                                 
00039         con_printf_xy    print formatted output on the X,Y screen position    
00040     clrscr           clear the screen                                        
00041         clear_line       clear a line                                            
00042         delay            wait n milliseconds 
00043         
00044         -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00045 */
00046 
00047 #include "console.h"
00048 
00049 #ifdef LINUX
00050         #include <ncurses.h>
00051         #include <unistd.h>
00052 //      #include <stdlib.h>
00053 #else
00054         #include <conio.h>
00055         #include <stdio.h>
00056         #include <stdarg.h>
00057         #include <windows.h>
00058 
00059 static HANDLE ocon, icon;
00060 #endif

00065 /****************************************************************************/
00066 /*                              GLOBAL VARIABLES                            */
00067 /****************************************************************************/
00068 
00069 /*------------------------------- log file ---------------------------------*/
00070 FILE *log_file = NULL;                /* log file pointer */
00071 char LOG_FILE_NAME[] = "LOG_FILE";    /* log file name */
00072 
00073 /*------------------------------- console info -----------------------------*/
00074 
00075 #ifndef LINUX
00076         BOOL t_type = TERM_NOT_INIT;
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 
00080 /****************************************************************************/
00081 /*                              CON_INIT                                    */
00082 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00083 /* Initialize the console                                                   */
00084 /****************************************************************************/
00085 
00086 void con_init()
00087 {
00088 #ifdef LINUX
00089 
00090   initscr();
00091   cbreak();
00092   noecho();
00093   nodelay(stdscr, FALSE);
00094   curs_set(FALSE);
00095 
00096 #else
00097 
00098   COORD coordScreen = { 0, 0 };    /* home of the cursor */
00099   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbi; /* to get buffer info */  
00100   BOOL bSuccess;
00101   DWORD cCharsWritten;
00102   DWORD dwConSize; /* number of character cells in the current buffer */
00103 
00104  
00105   ocon = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE); /* handle for the standard output */
00106   icon = GetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE);  /* handle for the standard input */
00107 
00108   t_type =TERM_INIT;
00109   clrscr();  /* clear the screen */
00110 
00111   /* information about the specified console screen buffer*/
00112   bSuccess = GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(ocon, &csbi);
00113   
00114   dwConSize = csbi.dwSize.X * csbi.dwSize.Y;
00115 
00116   /* set the buffer's attributes */
00117   bSuccess = FillConsoleOutputAttribute(ocon, csbi.wAttributes,
00118              dwConSize, coordScreen, &cCharsWritten);
00119 
00120 #endif
00121 }

00128 /****************************************************************************/

00130 void con_end()
00131 {
00132 #ifdef LINUX
00133   
00134   endwin();
00135 
00136 #endif
00137 }

00140 /******************************************************************************/
00141 /*                             WRITE_LOG                                      */
00142 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00143 /* parameters:    msg        ->  log message text                             */
00144 /* return:          0        ->  some errors occurred                         */
00145 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00146 /* Write a messege in the log file                                            */
00147 /******************************************************************************/
00148 
00149 int write_log(char *msg)
00150 {
00151   if(log_file == NULL)
00152     {
00153     log_file = fopen(LOG_FILE_NAME,"w");   /* open log file */
00154     if(log_file == NULL)
00155       {
00156       printf("\n\nCan't open log file\n\n");
00157       return 0;
00158       }
00159     }
00160   fprintf(log_file,"%s\n",msg);   /* write the error message in the log file */
00161   fflush(stdout);                 /* empty the output buffer */
00162   return -1;
00163 }
00164 
00165 
00166 /******************************************************************************/
00167 /*                               CON_GETCH                                    */
00168 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00169 /* return:        c  ->  ascii code of pressed key                            */
00170 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00171 /* Get a char from the console without echoing                                */
00172 /* return the character read                                                  */
00173 /******************************************************************************/
00174 
00175 int  con_getch(void)
00176 {
00177 #ifdef LINUX
00178 
00179   int i;
00180   
00181   while( ( i = getch() ) == ERR );
00182   return i;
00183 
00184 #else  
00185     
00186   return _getch(); 
00187 
00188 #endif  
00189 }
00190 
00191 
00192 /******************************************************************************/
00193 /*                               CON_KBHIT                                    */
00194 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00195 /* return:        0  ->  no key pressed                                       */
00196 /*                c  ->  ascii code of pressed key                            */
00197 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00198 /* Read the standard input buffer; if it is empty, return 0 else read and     */
00199 /* return the ascii code of the first char in the buffer. A call to this      */
00200 /* function doesn't stop the program if the input buffer is empty.            */
00201 /******************************************************************************/
00202 
00203 char con_kbhit()
00204 {
00205 #ifdef LINUX
00206 
00207   int i, g;  
00208   
00209   nodelay(stdscr, TRUE);
00210   i = ( ( g = getch() ) == ERR ? 0 : g );
00211   nodelay(stdscr, FALSE);
00212 
00213   return i;   
00214 
00215 #else
00216   
00217   char c=0;
00218 
00219   if(kbhit())            
00220     c = (char)con_getch();  
00221   return(c);
00222 
00223 #endif
00224 }
00225 
00226 
00227 /******************************************************************************/
00228 /*                               CON_SCANF                                    */
00229 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00230 /* parameters:     fmt       ->   format-control string                       */
00231 /*                 app       ->   argument                                    */
00232 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00233 /* return:         number of fields that were successfully converted and      */
00234 /*                 assigned (0  ->  no fields were assigned)                  */
00235 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00236 /* Read formatted data from the console into the locations given by argument  */
00237 /******************************************************************************/
00238 
00239 int con_scanf(char *fmt, void *app)
00240 {
00241 #ifdef LINUX
00242 
00243   int i;
00244 
00245   echo();
00246   i = scanw(fmt,app);    
00247   refresh();
00248   noecho();
00249   return i;
00250 
00251 #else
00252 
00253   int res;
00254       
00255   res = _cscanf(fmt, app) ;
00256 
00257   con_kbhit() ;                 /* Due to input reading problem */
00258 
00259   return res;
00260 
00261 #endif
00262 }
00263 
00264 
00265 /******************************************************************************/
00266 /*                               CON_PRINTF                                   */
00267 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00268 /* parameters:     fmt       ->   format string: must contain specifications  */
00269 /*                                that determine the output format for the    */
00270 /*                                argument                                    */
00271 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00272 /* return:         number of characters printed                               */
00273 /*                 or a negative value if an error occurs                     */
00274 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00275 /* Print formatted output to the standard output stream                       */ 
00276 /******************************************************************************/
00277 
00278 int con_printf(const char *fmt,...)
00279 {
00280 #ifdef LINUX
00281 
00282   va_list marker;
00283   int     i;
00284         
00285   va_start(marker,fmt);
00286   i = vwprintw(stdscr,fmt,marker);
00287   va_end(marker);
00288   
00289   refresh();
00290   return i;
00291 
00292 #else
00293 
00294   va_list marker;
00295   char buf[256];
00296 
00297   va_start(marker, fmt);       /* Initialize variable arguments. */
00298   vsprintf(buf,fmt,marker);
00299   va_end(marker);              /* Reset variable arguments.      */
00300 
00301   fflush(stdout);              /* Empty the output buffer */
00302 
00303   return _cprintf(buf);
00304 
00305 #endif
00306 }
00307 
00308 
00309 /****************************************************************************/
00310 /*                               GOTOXY                                     */
00311 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00312 /* parameters:     x, y ->   position on the screen                         */ 
00313 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00314 /* Place the cursor at position x,y on the screen                           */
00315 /****************************************************************************/
00316 
00317 void gotoxy(int x, int y)
00318 {
00319 #ifdef LINUX
00320 
00321   move(y-1, x-1);     
00322   refresh();
00323 
00324 #else
00325 
00326   COORD coord;
00327 
00328   coord.X = x-1;
00329   coord.Y = y-1;
00330   SetConsoleCursorPosition(ocon,coord);
00331 
00332 #endif
00333 }
00334 
00335 
00336 /****************************************************************************/
00337 /*                             CON_PRINTF_XY                                */
00338 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00339 /* parameters:     xpos, ypos ->   position on the screen                   */ 
00340 /*                 msg        ->   message text                             */
00341 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00342 /* return:         number of characters printed                             */
00343 /*                 or a negative value if an error occurs                   */
00344 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00345 /* Print formatted output on the X,Y screen position                        */
00346 /****************************************************************************/
00347 
00348 int con_printf_xy(uint xpos, uint ypos, char *fmt,...)
00349 {
00350 #ifdef LINUX
00351 
00352   va_list marker;
00353   int     i;
00354 
00355   move(ypos-1, xpos-1);     
00356   refresh();
00357         
00358   va_start(marker,fmt);
00359   i = vwprintw(stdscr,fmt,marker);
00360   va_end(marker);
00361   
00362   refresh();
00363   return i;
00364 
00365 #else
00366 
00367   va_list marker;
00368   char buf[256];
00369 
00370   gotoxy(xpos, ypos);            /* Set the cursor position */
00371  
00372   va_start(marker, fmt);         /* Initialize variable arguments. */
00373   vsprintf(buf,fmt,marker); 
00374   va_end(marker);                /* Reset variable arguments.      */
00375 
00376   fflush(stdout);                /* Empty the output buffer */
00377 
00378   return _cprintf(buf); 
00379 
00380 #endif
00381 }

00383 
00384 /****************************************************************************/
00385 /*                               CLRSCR                                     */
00386 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00387 /* Clear the screen                                                         */
00388 /****************************************************************************/
00389 
00390 void clrscr(void)
00391 {
00392 #ifdef LINUX
00393 
00394   clear();  
00395   move(0,0); 
00396   refresh();
00397 
00398 #else
00399 
00400   COORD coordScreen = { 0, 0 };    /* home of the cursor */
00401   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbi; /* to get buffer info */
00402   BOOL bSuccess;
00403   DWORD cCharsWritten;
00404   DWORD dwConSize; /* number of character cells in the current buffer */
00405 
00406   /* information about the specified console screen buffer*/
00407   bSuccess = GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(ocon, &csbi);
00408   
00409   dwConSize = csbi.dwSize.X * csbi.dwSize.Y;
00410  
00411   /* fill the entire screen with blanks */
00412   bSuccess = FillConsoleOutputCharacter(ocon, (TCHAR) ' ',
00413              dwConSize, coordScreen, &cCharsWritten);
00414    
00415   /* set the buffer's attributes */
00416   bSuccess = FillConsoleOutputAttribute(ocon, csbi.wAttributes,
00417              dwConSize, coordScreen, &cCharsWritten);
00418     
00419   /* put the cursor at (0, 0) */
00420   bSuccess = SetConsoleCursorPosition(ocon, coordScreen);
00421 
00422 #endif
00423 }
00424 
00425 
00426 /****************************************************************************/
00427 /*                              CLEAR_LINE                                  */
00428 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00429 /* parameters:     line ->   line to clear                                  */ 
00430 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00431 /* Clear a line of the screen                                               */
00432 /****************************************************************************/
00433 
00434 void clear_line(uint line)
00435 {
00436 #ifdef LINUX
00437         
00438   gotoxy(1, line);
00439   clrtoeol();
00440 
00441 #else
00442 
00443   COORD coordScreen;
00444   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbi; /* to get buffer info */
00445   BOOL bSuccess;
00446   DWORD cCharsWritten;
00447   DWORD dwLineSize; /* number of character cells in the line to clear */
00448   DWORD dwConSize; /* number of character cells in the current buffer */
00449 
00450   /* information about the specified console screen buffer*/
00451   bSuccess = GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(ocon, &csbi);
00452   
00453   dwConSize = csbi.dwSize.X * csbi.dwSize.Y;
00454   dwLineSize = csbi.dwSize.X;
00455  
00456   coordScreen.X=0;
00457   coordScreen.Y=line-1;
00458 
00459   /* fill the entire screen with blanks */
00460   bSuccess = FillConsoleOutputCharacter(ocon, (TCHAR) ' ',
00461              dwLineSize, coordScreen, &cCharsWritten);  
00462 
00463   coordScreen.X=0;
00464   coordScreen.Y=csbi.dwCursorPosition.Y;
00465 
00466   /* set the buffer's attributes */
00467   bSuccess = FillConsoleOutputAttribute(ocon, csbi.wAttributes,
00468              dwConSize, coordScreen, &cCharsWritten);
00469 
00470 #endif
00471 }
00472 
00473 
00474 /****************************************************************************/
00475 /*                             DELAY                                        */
00476 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00477 /* parameters:     del        ->   delay in millisecond                     */ 
00478 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00479 /* Wait msec milliseconds                                                   */
00480 /****************************************************************************/
00481 
00482 void delay(int msec)
00483 {
00484 #ifdef LINUX
00485   
00486   usleep(msec*1000); 
00487         
00488 #else
00489 
00490   Sleep(msec);
00491 
00492 #endif
00493 }
